headline: Rolled Flank Steak
description: Rolled flank steak makes for a beautiful presentation, with the pinwheel cuts showcasing the fillings of fresh spinach, mushroom, red pepper and provolone. This is an always impressive and secretly simply preparation!
name: Rolled Flank Steak
recipeIngredient: 0.5 red bell pepper, seeded and cut into strips

recipeInstructions.text: Place the flank steak on a cutting board with the short end closest to you. Starting from one of the long sides, cut through the meat horizontally to within 1/2 inch of the opposite edge. (You can also ask your butcher to butterfly the flank steak for you instead of cutting it yourself.)
Mix the soy sauce, olive oil, and steak seasoning together in a gallon-sized resealable plastic bag. Marinate flank steak in the refrigerator 4 hours to overnight.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a glass baking dish.

Lay out the flank steak flat in front of you with the grain of the meat running from left to right. Layer the provolone across the steak, leaving a 1-inch border. Arrange the bacon, spinach, red pepper, and mushrooms across the cheese covered steak in stripes running in the same direction as the grain of the meat. Roll the flank steak up and away from you, so that when the roll is cut into the pinwheel shape, each of the filling ingredients can be seen. Roll firmly, but be careful not to squeeze the fillings out the ends. Once rolled, tie every 2 inches with kitchen twine.

Place in prepared baking dish, and bake in preheated oven for one hour, or until the internal temperature reaches 145 degrees F (65 degrees C). Remove from the oven and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes before cutting into 1 inch slices. Be sure to remove the twine before serving!

review.reviewBody: Pecorino cheese and sun dried tomatoes add another dimension!
My family loves this dish. They have requested this dish many times. I’ve never done this dish ever. Even as a cook in the Army. I would totally recommend this to anybody.
Made this for dinner tonight, and it was delicious! The marinade was so tasty! Start to finish, this was very easy, and I will make it again!
I made this last week for my husband and I for dinner and WOW !!! This recipe is a winner ! I’ll be making it again soon. So, so good !!!
I made this dish tonight. Served it with wild rice with mushrooms. My fiancé and I loved it. I think next time I will have the butcher butterfly it.
Excellent use of flank steak!
Used pepper jack cheese instead of provolone.
Cooked it on my pellet smoker!! Pecan pellets......delicious
It was good
This was really good and flavorful. We served with rice pilaf. Didn't have kitchen twine, so used a skewer to hold in place.
Great flavor! the thinner the flank the better.

Wanted a festive dish for an elegant dinner with friends. This did the trick. It was delicious! Not a bit was left over. Served with baby new potatoes, creamed spinach, salad, shrimp coctail appetizer, wine and candle light. Perfect.

The marinade is good and the flavor is good, but the raw bacon on the inside is a no-go. It's a little borderline on food safety.

This recipe would be 5 stars with some other precooked pork product in there (prosciutto anybody?) or with the bacon placed on top.

You cannot ruin this recipe even if you don't have all the right ingredients! Don't have steak seasoning? Use whatever herbs your family loves. My husband needs low salt, so I used the side pork that he cooks on his smoker and then throws in the freezer. I didn't have a red pepper but I always have a jar of roasted red peppers. I used the lower sodium Swiss cheese and less of it. We decided that this was a main dish to serve guests.
Delish! I followed the recipe exactly as written. You will not be disappointed.
Totally agree with cooking the bacon and spinach beforehand. Even the mushrooms. Clearly a 5 star meal and family favorite. Have made it twice within a month!
It was a bit in my house. My kids (12 & 10) absolutely loved it so much they asked to have the leftovers for dinner again the next night!
I made this as is, and it was so good, my husband asked for a repeat within one week!
Excellent!

My steak wasn't very thick to begin with, and even thinner after butterflying. I guessed that it would take less time to cook, but didn't check the temperature soon enough, and it was overdone. The flavor was good. I made a sauce with the marinade.

Very surprisied at how fast and easy with beautiful results! I pounded my flank steaks just a little thinking I didn’t have enough area to lay out my filling, but didn’t seem to make a physical difference. The steak, however, was so tender and juicy and I poured all scraps and juices over the meat before serving. 
Will make again, especially with company! I think I could make earlier in day and just remove from fridge early enough to bring meat back to room temp before searing them.
My Mom used to make this, so when I ran across this recipe, I decided to give it a try! It was worth it. Thank you.
I’d love to see a video. The instructions exceed my experience.
Outstanding! Followed recipe to the t and came out perfectly. Not sure about the negative comments on marinating. Mine was perfect. Would prepare this again for special dinner with guests!
Excellent and super easy! The soy sauce flavor seemed a little strong but we all enjoyed it. Will be making again.
This was amazing when I make it the next time, I will try reducing the soy sauce by1/2 to reduce some of the sodium content. Absolutely delicious

Loved this recipe and I made a few changes... I marinated the meat in Gravy Master (not affiliated with them). The pan drippings from the GM made for a fantastic sauce! I cooked the bacon before rolling and I also basted with butter when I pulled it out of the oven to rest. I found that it was even tastier as leftovers the next day!

Definitely 5 Star! I left out the peppers and only had time to marinate for 2 hours, but it was fabulous! Very tender. The only thing I will do differently next time is to partially pre cook the bacon. Some of it didn’t crisp up, but it was cooked enough to eat. The flavors are indescribably wonderful!

I had a frozen flank steak and butterflied it while still slightly frozen, which makes it easier to cut. The steak was delicious but pretty salty with steak seasoning, soy and bacon. You could go low sodium to reduce the salt. It probably doesn't matter what you stuff with. I used shredded cheddar (barely noticeable flavor), spinach, medium spice pre-roasted hatch peppers, and bacon. I would definitely pre-cook the bacon a bit. I also like rare red meat but the men prefer well done, so i had to cook it until 155 degrees . I Loved it!
This recipe is over the top. My family gives it a big 10. Made as written and will be making it again. A great recipe, thanks for sharing. >^..^
Huge hit Easter dinner

"This is my favorite steak" is what my boyfriend declared when I made this. Honestly, I didn't think it was anything special; hence, a combined 4 stars. I used ricotta, thawed frozen spinach, and roasted red peppers, and skipped the bacon to make it South Beach diet friendly. I tenderized the meat and pinned it with wet toothpicks. Baked for 1 hour.

Great recipe very easy cooked 350 degrees for about 45 min.
Or until 150-160 degrees very tasty! Marinated for 2 hours 
Sautéed crimini mushrooms red pepper and cheese! Rolled
it up tied it then set on a rack salt & pepper.
My hubby and I love it!
Thanks it's a real keeper very creative you can add whatever ??
I used shoulder round steak, 1 envelope McCormick Montreal steak mix, and substituted parsley for mushrooms. Excellent!

This was amazing!! We're stuck at home for a snow/ice day and I wanted something supremely tasty. I happened to have a flank steak in the freezer, so I went searching for recipes that didn't use the grill. (Although next time I think I will cook this on the Big Green Egg-indirect for that hint of smoke!) I had to sub a few things because I didn't have them on hand. I used chive/onion cream cheese and roasted red peppers, but I had all the other stuff. My steak felt a little too thin to butterfly, so it turned into more of a "fold" than a "roll", but it was still delicious! Next time I will ask the butcher to butterfly for me so I can get the true roll effect. This is definitely a "company" meal!! And 145 got it to a perfect medium!!

This was amazing!! We're stuck at home for a snow/ice day and I wanted something supremely tasty. I happened to have a flank steak in the freezer, so I went searching for recipes that didn't use the grill. (Although next time I think I will cook this on the Big Green Egg-indirect for that hint of smoke!) I had to sub a few things because I didn't have them on hand. I used chive/onion cream cheese and roasted red peppers, but I had all the other stuff. My steak felt a little too thin to butterfly, so it turned into more of a "fold" than a "roll", but it was still delicious! Next time I will ask the butcher to butterfly for me so I can get the true roll effect. This is definitely a "company" meal!! And 145 got it to a perfect medium!!

I made this for my husband and, I on New Years day. I couldn't find flank steak so I used a flat skirt steak and divided it to long pieces. I followed the recipe with the exception of rolling the steaks in bacon. I opted to use a smoked gouda and used frozen fire roasted peppers and onion blend that I defrosted in the microwave and chopped fine,along with the mushrooms. I rolled baby spinach leaves,gouda,and mushrooms into the two bundles and secured the mixture ends with toothpicks. Taking the hint from another reviewer,I sprinkled the rolled steak bundles with garlic powder,fresh ground pepper,and a sprinkling of dried thyme. Came out superb! Cutos Angelshark.:)

I almost followed the recipe on this - just added more of everything. It was wonderful - great flavor! We served with garlic mashed potatoes and roasted brussell sprouts w/pancetta. Excellent combo. This is a recipe I will definitely include in my "go to" file. Not only easy to prepare, but beautiful to serve.

It was a hit !!!' The house smelled heavenly ! And the recipe divine !!!! I did marinate the meat for about 25 hrs just because of time schedules . Most definitely will make again as the men in the house LOVED IT !!! DELISH !!!!

Turned out awesome. Did make it with bacon on inside on one and bacon on outside. Outside was better bacon was crispier. I also wilted spinach in bacon grease and garlic and added a little Canadian spice to the outside. Winner recipe!!!

This was very good however; if I make it again, which I more than likely will, I won't use thick cut bacon. It didn't cook through. I would use either regular cut or better yet prosciutto. Also I used skirt steak.

Really fantastic recipe! I ended up marinating the meat for about 8 hours, making the roll, then putting back in the marinade again . . . because, you know, life doesn't always go as planned! We ended up eating this tonight - a good 24 hours after I made the roll, and it was delicious! We like our meat medium-rare, so I cooked it only to about an internal temp of 125, then let it rest. Next time - I will pre-cook the bacon a bit before making the roll because of this. It was so juicy and flavorful! Thank you for sharing this delicious recipe!

Made this for company one night. It turned out great, lots of compliments and a print off of the recipe. After reading through the previous reviews here are my tweaks to this; I did not have a flank steak, so I used very thin sliced sirloin and made individual rolls. I used frozen spinach instead. I precooked the bacon. I rough chopped the mushrooms, red pepper and bacon, plus added onion and gorgonzola along with the provolone. I sprinkled garlic powder over it all before rolling the steak (b/c we don't cook anything w/o onion and garlic). I rolled and placed seam side down on foil lined pan. Sprinkled sea salt and pepper over top of rolled steaks and baked for the 1hr--which was perfect. I made a sauce from the drippings, added beef broth and a splash of red wine and cornstarch---YUM. I served with asparagus and wild rice in which I added the left over mushrooms, red pepper and onion. Looked wonderful and tasted great! Oh, and I only marinated for 3-4hrs, which was plenty.

I made this exactly as the recipe calls for, and it was amazing!! The only change I might do next time is cook the bacon a bit first or maybe swap it out all together and use prosciutto instead. I served it with rice, and dribbled the pan drippings over it, YUM!

This is an awesome recipe! I substituted onions for the red peppers. Also, keep in mind that the mushrooms and spinach will release a lot of moisture, so I actually drained my filling before rolling it, which made rolling much easier and less slippery. The man at my local meat department said he had no idea how to butterfly the flank, so I had to do it myself, which of course was a massive balls-up. HOWEVER, a few healthy whacks with a meat mallet quickly set it to rights. I served it with a salad and some roasted potatoes and my family loved it. I'll definitely be making this again to hone my knife skills!
Has a great flavor and at the time I didn't have any mushrooms. I pulled these from the freezer, they freeze well, and cooked them up. Made a mushroom gravy and these were great.
I made this and it was terrific. I only marinated it a couple of hours, didn't want too much soy flavor. Loved the peppers in it.

Followed recipe as written, with the exception of taking one steak out after 50 minutes, as we prefer our steak medium-rare; also omitted mushrooms. I had two steaks, with one being thicker than the other - the thick one I baked for about 70 minutes for medium, so thickness will make a difference. I marinated over night, and rolled tightly in the am; kept in fridge til ready to roast. Voila! 

I researched numerous recipes on cooking "rolled flank steaks" and went with the baking method, as this was for a party and baking was the easiest way to go. But if not in a rush, next time I will make pinwheels (individual slices using toothpicks) and use the "sear, then bake" method (sear one minute per side, then bake for 10-15 minutes in 350 oven). I think this would be a 5 star with the meat being seared - I think it would also improve the presentation. Marinating and ingredients go very well together.
I used teriyaki sauce in place of the soy and added 2 tbls of red wine cooking wine. I also added minced garlic. minced the mushrooms and pressed both onto the meat.
So good and easy!
followed the recipe and loved it
This was so good and so easy. I followed the recipe, replacing thin sliced onions for mushrooms, it turn out perfect. Huge hit with my teen and husband.

I cooked this for the first time and our dinner guests loved it! I've never asked the grocery butcher for help before, but he made a suggestion, butterflied the sirloin tip roast, and saved money too!
Holy cow!! This was one of the best things I have ever eaten! The steak tasted like beef jerky!!
Very good, husband enjoyed it!
Super easy and delicious! I can stop searching for a rolled steak recipe now! Thank you!
Delicious and fancy, yet rather easy. Will be using this recipe for nice dinners and company. I followed the recipe exactly and was very happy with the results.

This dish was surprisingly easy to prepare, and was flavorful and delicious as written. DEFINITELY use a meat thermometer, if I had cooked for the recommended time of one hour, this dish would have been extremely undercooked. I ended up cooking this for almost an hour and 20 minutes before the thermometer registered done.

We needed to downsize our Christmas dinner and this was perfect! The only change I made was to substitute sun-dried tomatoes for the red pepper, which my daughter doesn't like. I used inexpensive, thin bacon, which made it easier to roll. I was also worried that there was too much cheese, but it worked out fine. Served it with smashed potatoes; broccoli w/cheese sauce; and a spinach salad with feta, craisins, mandarin oranges, & raspberry vinaigrette. Simple, but festive. It got rave reviews. Thanks!

Amazing! All three of my guests went back for seconds! I did make a gravy, as some users recommended but it wasn't needed. I had to combine three pounded butterflies steaks together to make it two pounds and I doubled the insides. Made for trickier rolling and added half an hour to the cook time, but otherwise it was great! Also I subbed cooked turkey bacon for the bacon.
I make this for X-mas dinner every year and on special occasions. My go to dinner for a nice night. Delicious!
Made this many times. Delicious. Passed recipe on to my brother in law. He loved it.
This was easy and oh so delicious! Thank you!
Loved it. I only marinated for one hour and used Angus top sirloin steak. It cooked to medium rare in about 25 minutes at 350 degrees.
Excellent. Ask butcher to butterfly the flank steak, as it's not easy to do later.
we loved this flank steak is juicy and really tasty

It was amazing but I didn't have any provolone so I used ricotta n I didn't have any red bell peppers but I did every thing the shape but the bacon I chopped it up and cooked it first cause I don't like chewie bacon then I mix it into the ricotta and only baked it for about 45 min and I was amazing
Delicious and surprisingly simple. Will make again!
good meal
good meal

This recipe was great! I did not follow the ingredient list exactly because I wanted to use what I had on hand...I used baby kale in place of the spinach and a moz/prov blend of shredded cheese...it was delicious and I will definitely make this recipe again ...maybe I'll use the listed ingredients next time... :)
Just made it, needed to use turkey bacon as husband is allergic to pork. Was outstanding.

Oh my!!!!! What a wonderful dish. only used a slight amount of olive oil (both sides) salt/pepper.I did like others and used the bottle Roasted peppers, no bacon. I did pre cook my mushrooms and then added the fresh spinach just to wilt. Not only is the flavors perfect but looks like a real Chef cooked for us... I can hardly wait to make again and again!!!!

Finally! Been searching for a good rolled flank steak recipe. This was absolutely amazing! Followed the recipe exactly, no changes needed. Amazing flavor, melt in your mouth. Will do this again and again! Thank you!
Great recipe! This was my first time cooking flank steak and it turned out perfectly. I would suggest letting it marinade for several hours or overnight.

Really good recipe! I'm not big fan of soy sauce so I changed up the marinade for one that I use for grilling meat and turned out to be amazing anyway. For the marinade: I used half a light beer (I've found Corona or Stella are best for this), 1/2 cup of olive oil, the red bell pepper slices, 1 medium white onion (sliced into half rings), parsley and cilantro to taste, I used a tbsp of each. Also instead of the steak seasoning I added Trader Joe's "21 seasoning salute" (about a tsp). Let it marinade in the fridge for 2-3 hours. I added the veggies from the marinade inside the roll, along with some spinach, grilled leeks and muenster cheese instead. Making this again for sure.

My family LOVED this recipe. I had to tweak it just a bit with the marinade because of what I had on hand. I used teriyaki sauce and soy sauce in the marinade because I didn't have enough soy. Then I added garlic powder with parsley and onion powder along with the olive oil. I did cook my bacon first till it was just crisp. I added about 2 tbs of chopped red onions to the roll. I also only marinated for about an hour as I got started late. The sauce was delicious. This was one of the prettiest dishes I've made by far. Thanks so much for sharing!!!
This dish did not work for me. The meat was undercooked, the bacon made the dish very greasy and had a very strong taste.

I followed the directions to a T, the center of my meat was still raw when I pulled it out and all of my cheese had melted & pooled out into the bottom of the baking dish. If I attempt this again I will reduce the amount of olive oil it seemed a greasy.

This was fantastic! Really easy to make and everyone raved.
I took a few of the suggestions, precooking the bacon as well as roasting the pepper. We don't care for spinach, so we left that out.
Definitely give this recipe a try, you won't be disappointed!
MY 4 boys eat plain, plain, plain! When I tried this it was GONE, GONE, GONE....YAY!
This is one of my favorite recipes. I love the pinwheel cut with the meat and veggies. I feel like a professional when I serve this dish.
Five Stars all the way!!!!

Turned out great! I made a few adjustments only because I can never follow a recipe to a "t" I didnt have steak seasoning so I just added fresh cracked black pepper, garlic powder, and 2 tsp. of dijon mustard. It was fabulous! Family loved it and it was a great new way to have steak.

loved this recipe, i used garlic herb goat cheese instead of provolone cheese, and put roasted red peppers with the spinach leaves I put the bacon on top and rolled up and pinned with wooden picks. it was marvelous

I found this recipe and my girlfriend made it for our New Year's Eve dinner. It was DELICIOUS and beautiful! She said it was pretty easy to make, too. Definitely keeping this recipe in the mix, especially for entertaining! Thanks for a great addition to my book!
Used what was left to make a salad the next day. Was devine.

This was fantastic. I didn't add as much cheese because it sound like a lot, but I was wrong, I should have added it all. I also added an extra piece of bacon, which I sholuldn't have done. The bacon adds salt and it was a bit too salty with the extra piece. Recipes was great as is! Next time I make it, I will follow directions exactly. YUM!!

Excellent!!! I made this for dinner and my husband and 12.5 month old LOVES it! Thanks for sharing!

We made a new twist with this dinner. We mixed together cooked sweet Italian sausage, a package of the garlic and herb laughing cow cream cheese, a box of spinach instead of the ingredients suggested. 
We then rolled it up in the flank steak and cooked like directed.
absolutely delicious!!
Ive made these a few times now, my husband and I both love them. They very presentable, as well as yummy :-D

This was sooo good! It was also very easy to make. The only thing I did differently was to use the pre-cooked bacon bits found in the salad dressing isle. I use these all of the time being a working mom with three kids, it is a real time saver. My husband loved the way it tasted and the presentation made me look like a pro!
I made this just as directed. It made an excellent dinner. I wouldn't hesitate to serve this to company.
My husband is a very "meat & potato" guy. I tried this for father's day dinner, and he said "this could be new favorite" - I was so excited. thanks for the recipe

My family really liked this. Even my son, who normally wouldn't touch a mushroom or a bell pepper, cleaned his plate! Next time I will thicken the pan juices with a little corn starch to make a sauce. The only change I made was to use about a third of a package of frozen chopped (thawed) spinach, since I didn't have fresh. I think I could have used more. The dish is relatively easy, once the meat is butterflied, and attractive enough for company! Thanks for the idea!

This is a fabulous recipe. I Marinated the steak for two days before baking, and it melted in your mouth. I did bake it for an hour and a half, as I like my steak med. Well, and it was just a little pink in the middle...perfection. Will be making it again soon!

Will pre-cook the bacon next time even more. I used my Convention oven and this was done in 35 minutes. The bacon, although I partically pre-cooked was still underdone. I also will try with the garlic-herb cheese next time as that sounds great too.
i did not care for this.
